sentences.en: A hush fell over the crowd and I knew something terrible had happened.
sentences.cn: 人群突然一片肃静，我知道一定发生了什么可怕的事。

sentences.en: A hush fell over the onlookers.
sentences.cn: 旁观者们突然静了下来.

sentences.en: A reverent hush descended on the multitude.
A sudden hush fell over the crowd.
sentences.cn: 人群突然变得鸦雀无声。
不要把这丑事声张出去.

sentences.en: Ella asked them to hush their voices.
Hush now and try to sleep.
Hush, boys, the party's getting noisy.
sentences.cn: 嘘!小声点, 孩子们, 你们太闹了.

sentences.en: Hush, my love, it's all right.
Hush, now. Try to get to sleep.
sentences.cn: 嘘，别哭了。 好好睡吧。

sentences.en: I had to box Max's ears to get him to hush.
sentences.cn: 我不得不打了马克斯一耳光让他闭嘴。

sentences.en: In the afternoon hush the volume of sound was startling.
sentences.cn: 这下午一片岑寂,鸟儿的叫声大得惊人.

sentences.en: The crime was so base that everyone wanted to hush it up.
sentences.cn: 这一罪行如此卑鄙无耻，大家都不想声张出去。

sentences.en: The Ministry desperately tried to hush up the whole affair.
sentences.cn: 部里拼命想隐瞒整个事件。

sentences.en: The President tried to hush up the fact that his adviser had lied.
sentences.cn: 总统试图掩盖他的顾问说谎的事实.

sentences.en: They were desperate to keep the marriage hush-hush.
sentences.cn: 他们拼命想要瞒住这桩婚事。

words.tran_cn: 安静；缄默；肃静（hush的过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: 肃静；掩盖，防止…张扬出去

trans.tran_en: used to tell people to be quiet, or to comfort a child who is crying or upset
a period of silence, especially when people are expecting something to happen
to make someone stop shouting, talking, crying etc
to make someone stop shouting, talking, crying etc
